Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Co-Editor of the special issue "Collaborative administration: the management of successful networks" (with M. Meneguzzo and N. Riccucci), Public Management Review, forthcoming 2017

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Conference paper: “Who is interested in the Italian privatisations? An analysis of the corporate governance structure of the Italian public utilities”, with Fabrizio Zerbini, XIII Workshop Aidea Giovani, “The evolution of corporate governance system in Italy”, Bologna, 6th November 2001 (in Italian).

Conference paper: “Reasons behind the Italian local utilities alliances: managing through stakeholders interests”, Third EURAM Annual Conference “Managing through Diversity”, Doctoral Consortium, Milan, 3-5 April 2003.

Conference paper: “Democracy in Italian local utilities decision-making: managing through stakeholders”, 2003 Annual Meeting Academy of Management “Democracy in a Knowledge Economy”, Doctoral Consortium SIM: Division, Seattle, 1-6 August 2003.

Conference paper: “The listing of the Italian local utilities: the corporate governance as a mean to balance the shareholders’ interests”, with Nicola Bellé, Aidea Giovani Meeting “Publicly-owned enterprises”, Florence, 23th July 2004 (in Italian).

Conference paper: “Understanding multi-stakeholder decision-making. A constructivist perspective”, 2004 Annual Meeting Academy of Management “Creating Actionable Knowledge”, SIM Division, New Orleans, 6-11 August 2004.

Conference paper “The evolution of corporate-governance in public sector organizations: between the efficiency and the effectiveness of the decision-making processes”, with Giovanni Valotti, AIDEA Meeting “Designing decision-making processes”, Catania, 7-8 October 2004 (in Italian).

Conference paper: “Stakeholders’ role in strategic decision-making: between script and improvisation”, 2005 Annual Meeting of the European Academy of Management “Responsible management in an uncertain world”, Munich, 4-7 May, 2005.

Conference paper: “Stakeholder and citizen engagement in the work of public organizations: between transparency and accountability” with Giovanni Valotti, 22th EGOS Colloquium “The Organizing Society”, Bergen, 6 July-8 July 2006.

Conference paper: “What future for public employment? Moving between compliance and compromise”, 2006 EGPA annual Conference "Public Manager under pressure: between politics, professionalism and civil society " with Giovanni Valotti, Milan, 6-9 September 2006.

Conference paper: “Who and what really counts”. Answering at the crossroad between the resource dependence and the network theory” with Giovanni Valotti, fifth EABIS Colloquium “Corporate Sustainability, Strategic Management and the Stakeholder View of the Firm”, Milan, 11-12 September 2006.

Conference paper: “From New Public Management to direct democracy: stakeholder participation in decision-making” with Giovanni Valotti, 2006 EGPA annual Conference "Public Manager under pressure: between politics, professionalism and civil society ", Milan, 6-9 September 2006.

Conference paper: “Dancing among institutional, economic and political pressure. Reform processes and strategic responses in the public sector” with Greta Nasi, Alex Turrini, Giovanni Valotti, 23th EGOS Colloquium “Beyond Waltz - Dances of Individuals and Organization”, Wien, 5-7 July 2007.

Conference paper: “Institutional reforms and strategic responses in the public sector: The introduction of the performance-based pay system in Italian local governments", with Greta Nasi, Alex Turrini, Giovanni Valotti, 2007 Annual Meeting Academy of Management “Doing Well by Doing ”, Public and No-Profit Division, Philadelphia, 3-8 August 2007.

Conference paper: “Once Godot comes. Stalemate and breakthrough in multi-party issues” with Greta Nasi, Alex Turrini, Giovanni Valotti, 2007 Annual Meeting Academy of Management “Doing Well by Doing ”, Conflict Management Division, Philadelphia, 3-8 August 2007.
Conference paper: “Much tea about nothing: exploring civil service reform failures in Italy”, with Greta Nasi and Alex Turrini, 2007 APPAM Annual Meeting, Washington, 8-10 November 2007.

Conference paper: “Deadlock in Venice: exploring the art of compromise in participatory decision making processes”, with Alex Turrini, 24th EGOS Colloquium “Upsetting organizations”, Amsterdam, 10-12 July 2008.
Conference Organization: Chair of the doctoral session on “Corporate Governance of public utilities”, Workshop of Azienda Pubblica, Rome, 25-26 March 2010.

Conference Organization: Co-Chair of the panel track on “Politicians versus managers: the long-standing dilemma in public management literature”, at the 14th IRSPM Conference The crisis: challenges for public management”, Berne, 7-9 April 2010 (Co-Chair I. Steccolini).

Conference paper: “Public corporate governance in Italian public utilities: which balance between ownership and management? ”, with G. Nasi. and G. Valotti, 14th IRSPM Conference “The crisis: challenges for public management”, Berne, 7-9 April 2010.
Conference Organization: Co-Chair of the session on “Organizational Change & HRM”, at the 10th Euram Conference “Back to the future”, Rome, 19-22 May 2010 (Co-Chair M. Pasquier).

Conference paper: “To be or not to be managerial oriented. Corporate governance choices and strategic behavior of Italian local utilities”, Annual Conference on Management of Public Utilities, Novara, 3-4 July 2010.

Conference paper: “When civic culture meets strategy: exploring predictors of citizens’ engagement in participatory strategic plans in Italy”, with Marco Meneguzzo, 33rd EGPA Annual Conference, Toulouse, 8-10 September 2010.

Conference paper: “Ownership, network and governance. In search of a new equilibrium in the public service provision”, with M. Meneguzzo, Convegno dell'Accademia Italiana di Economia Aziendale (AIDEA), Milan, 21-22 October 2010.

Conference Organization: Co-Chair of the panel track on “Predicting the performance of public networks”, at the 15th IRSPM Conference “Value, Innovation and Partnership”, Dublin, 11-13 April 2011 (Co-Chairs M. Mandell, M. Meneguzzo).

Conference paper: “Managing successful networks: a “managerial style” for each season? The case of intermunicipality collaboration in Switzerland”, with L. Maccio’ and L. Pedrazzi, 15th IRSPM Conference “Value, innovation and partnership”, 11-13 April 2011, Dublin, Ireland.

Conference paper: “More politics or more management? Exploring the predictors of successful public management reforms”, with S. Calciolari and L. Maccio, 11th Annual Public Management Research Conference, June 2-4, 2011, Maxwell School of Management, Syracuse, US.

Conference paper: “Politicians, managers and professionals. Exploring the predictors and consequences of the Government role in Swiss public networks”, with L. Maccio’ and L. Pedrazzi 7th TAD on Strategic Management in the public sector, 22-25 June 2011, Rutgers University, Newark, New Jersey, US

Conference paper: “Public networks” say Americans, “public networks” reply Europeans, but are they talking about the same issue?”, with M. Meneguzzo and M. Mandell, 11th Annual Public Management Research Conference, June 2-4, 2011, Maxwell School of Management, Syracuse, US.

Conference paper: “Networks funded by the public sector can and should be evaluated” – Ok, but how?”, with L. Maccio’ and L. Pedrazzi, 11th Annual Public Management Research Conference, June 2-4, 2011, Maxwell School of Management, Syracuse, US.

Conference Organization: Co-Chair of the panel track on “Predicting the performance of public networks”, at the 16th IRSPM Conference Contradictions in public management. Managing in volatile times”, 11th – 13th April 2012, Rome, Italy. (Co-Chairs M. Mandell, M. Meneguzzo).
Conference paper: “Measuring the network performance”, with L. Maccio’, XVI IRSPM Conference, “Contradictions in public management. Managing in volatile times”, 11th – 13th April 2012, Rome, Italy.

Conference paper: “Una, nessuna, centomila recipes for a good network performance”, with J. Markovic and L. Maccio’, XVI IRSPM Conference, “Contradictions in public management. Managing in volatile times”, 11th – 13th April 2012, Rome, Italy.

Conference paper: “To Wind a Skein into a Ball: How to Govern and Manage Successful Networks, with L. Maccio’ and J. Markovic, 8th Transatlantic Dialogue Transitions in Governance, 7-9 June 2012, Nijmegen, The Netherlands.
Conference paper “Structure, strategies, mechanisms and performance in public networks”, with L. Maccio’, J. Markovic, M. Meneguzzo, EGPA 2012 Annual Conference, 6-9 September 2012, Bergen.
Conference Organization: Co-Chair of the EGPA Permanent Study Group “Public network policy and management” (Co-Chairs M. Mandell, M. Meneguzzo). 2013-2016 Egpa Conferences.

Conference paper: “Determinants of public network performance: linking governance forms, coordination mechanisms and managerial roles”, with L. Maccio’, and J. Markovic, XVII IRSPM Conference, “Public sector responses to global crisis”, 10th – 12th April 2013, Prague, Cezch Republic.
Conference paper “Network structure and management - two complementing necessities” with J. Markovic, EGPA 2013 Annual Conference, 6-9 September 2013, Dublin.

Conference Organization: Member of the Organizing Committee of Seventh Euro Mediterranean Dialogue on Public Management, MED 7 “Societal government and sustainable public management: Challenges for the Euro-MENA area” Roma – Italy, October 8, 9 & 10, 2014.

Conference Organization: Co-Chair of the 10 EGPA-ASPA Traslatantic Dialogue - 10TAD “From Public Administration to XXI Century Collaborative Administration – The role of public networks”, Lugano, 5-7 June 2014.

Conference paper: “How to make public networks survive. The pivotal role of the network manager”, with L. Maccio’, 10TAD “From Public Administration to XXI Century Collaborative Administration – The role of public networks”, 5-7 June 2014, Lugano.

Conference paper “Where do governance modes come from? Exploring the adoption of different modes of governance in public networks”, with L. Maccio’, 10TAD “From Public Administration to XXI Century Collaborative Administration – The role of public networks”, 5-7 June 2014, Lugano.
Conference paper: “Contingencies and Organizing Principles in Public Networks”, with J. Markovic, EGPA 2014 Annual Conference, 5-7 September 2014, Speyer, Germany.

Conference paper: “How to restore civil servants’ trust in Government? Count on public service motivation and leadership but avoid red tape”, with M. Barreca and L. Maccio’, 2015 International Congress of IIAS - Rio de Janeiro, 22-26 June 2015.

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Co-Principal Investigator. “Managerial change in the Italian public sector”, funded by Public Management & Policy Department – SDA Bocconi School of Management, January 2006-December 2006
Principal Investigator. “Collaboration in public decision-making: stalemate and breakthrough in multi-party issues” – funded by Bocconi University, September 2006-September 2008
Co-Principal Investigator. “What future for public employment?” – funded by SDA Bocconi School of Management Research Centre on Local Governments, January 2007-December 2007
Co-Principal Investigator. “Managerial change in the Italian public sector”, funded by Public Management & Policy Department – SDA Bocconi School of Management, January 2007-December 2007
Principal Investigator. “Network effects, corporate governance and performance in liberalized industries”, funded by SDA Bocconi School of Management Research Centre, May 2007-December 2008
Principal Investigator. “Enhancing the productivity of civil servants. How to reform the Italian public service”, funded by SDA Bocconi School of Management Research Centre, June 2007-December 2008
Co-Principal Investigator. “Corporate governance and strategic change in the public utilities industry”, funded by SDA Bocconi Research Centre on Local Governments, January 2008 – September 2008
Co-Principal Investigator. “Managerial change in the Italian public sector”, funded by Public Management & Policy Department – SDA Bocconi School of Management, January 2008-December 2008

Principal Investigator. “To be or not to be present”. Partnerships between politicians and managers to boost the public sector productivity”, funded by Public Management & Policy Department – SDA Bocconi School of Management, January 2009-December 2010

Principal Investigator. “Do intermunicipality networks really work? Exploring the visible and invisible predictors of public network performance”, funded by the FNSNF (Swiss National Fund for Scientific Research), May 2010-May 2013
Principal Investigator. “Governance and management of intermunicipality aggregations in Canton Ticino”, funded by SPAN (Swiss Public Administration Network), June 2010-June 2011
Co-Principal Investigator. “Who are Swiss public servants?”, funded by SPAN (Swiss Public Administration Network), September 2012-2014.

Principal Investigator. “Do intermunicipality networks really work? Exploring the visible and invisible predictors of public network performance”, funded by the FNSNF (Swiss National Fund for Scientific Research), May 2013-October 2013.

Principal Investigator. “10th Transatlantic Dialogue is: “From Public Administration to XXI Century Collaborative Administration. The role of public networks", funded by the FNSNF (Swiss National Fund for Scientific Research), June 2014

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Affiliation at: EGPA (European Group of Public Administration) – Permanent Working Group “Public network policies and management” (2013 - up to date); IRSPM (International Research Symposium on Public Management) (2011 up to date) ; EURAM (European Academy of Management) – Standing working group “Public Management” (concluded); EGOS (European Group of Organization Studies) – Standing Working Group “Organizing the Public Sector” (concluded); PMRA (Public Management Research Association) (concluded), (U.S.) Academy of Management -Public and Non Profit Division, Social Issue and Management Division, Organization and Management Theory Division, Conflict Management Division (concluded), Study Group Italian Academy of Management (AIDEA) on public services “Governance and strategy in public utility industry” (2006).

Best paper award at the 2008 New Public Sector Seminar, Edinburgh, for the paper “Do environmental and task characteristics matter? Unveiling the relevance of relational factors in the control of local public services”, (Co-Authors A. Ditillo, M. Liguori, M. Sicilia, I. Steccolini).

Bests paper award at the 2014 VI Workshop “Azienda Pubblica”, Novara, for the paper “Does public service motivation still matter? Exploring the determinants of the decision to enter politics in Switzerland”, (Co-Author L. Maccio’).

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: “The reform of the Education Ministry in Albany” (1999-2000) - Ministero della Pubblica Istruzione e della Ricerca Scientifica e Tecnologica - MURST (Project leader: L. Brusati).
“Transforming headmasters in school managers” - D.M. Agosto 1998 (1999-2000) – Sda Bocconi School of Management (Project leader: E. Borgonovi).
“Liberalization processes and public utilities’ alliances and mergers” - Sda Bocconi School of Management (Project leader: M. Elefanti).
“Change-management processes in public utilities” - Sda Bocconi School of Management (Project leader: M. Elefanti).
“New corporate governance models in Italian Regions”- Sda Bocconi School of Management (Project leaders: G. Valotti, D. Cristofoli).
Investigator: “Metropolitan governance: the case of the Milan Municipality (2003-2004) – funded by SDA Bocconi School of Management Research Centre (Principal Investigator: G. Valotti).

Investigator: “Corporate governance and decision-making in public sector organizations (2004-2005) – funded by Public Management & Policy Department – SDA Bocconi School of Management (Principal Investigator: G. Valotti).
Investigator: “Strategic decision-making in public sector organizations” (2004-2006) – funded by Bocconi University (Principal Investigator: Les Metcalfe).

Reviewer for journals and conferences: Public Administration, Public Administration Review, Journal of Management and Governance, Public Management Review, Yearbook of the Swiss Society of Administrative Science, Journal of Comparative Policy Analysis - Special Issue on “Public Service Personnel Policies: Impact on Policy Implementation Related Performance”, Business & Society - Special Issue on “The Politics of Stakeholder Influence”, “Azienda Pubblica” (The Italian Journal of Public Management), “Economia & Management”, Workshop Azienda Pubblica, Annual Meeting of the European Academy of Management (EURAM), Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management.
Investigator: “Decentralization processes in Italy (2004-2005) – funded by Istituto Regionale di Ricerca della Lombardia (IRER) (Principal Investigator: G. Valotti).

Investigator: “Public utilities between managerial discretion and public interest” (2004-2005) – funded by Public Management & Policy Department – SDA Bocconi School of Management (Principal Investigator: G. Valotti, M. Elefanti).

Investigator: “Stakeholder salience in strategic decision-making” (2005-2006) – funded by Public Management & Policy Department - SDA Bocconi School of Management (Principal Investigator: G. Valotti).
“Observatory on managerial change in the Italian public sector” (Ocap) - Sda Bocconi School of Management (Project leaders: G. Valotti, D. Cristofoli, A. Turrini).

Investigator: “Managing the relationships between public utilities and local governments” (2005-2006) – funded by SDA Bocconi School of Management Research Centre (Principal Investigator: I. Steccolini).
Investigator: “E-government diffusion in Italian local governments” (2006) – funded by Public Management & Policy Department – SDA Bocconi School of Management (Principal Investigator: G. Nasi).
